posts.author: kdoemelt
posts.post_text: May 13, 2015 at 7:59 PM#3Another way to do this would be to create a filter with the selected attributes. The result is the same.If you want the current selection in the programmer to take values from a selected fixture then marco is :1: Filter (x)2: At Fixture @Everything in the programmer will take the filtered values from the next number you type.If you want to specify a target fixture not currently in the programmer then add this line to the top:Fixture @This will leave values already in the programmer in place, and put the filtered values into the selected fixture.Thanks,Kurt

posts.author: kdoemelt
posts.post_text: May 13, 2015 at 11:52 PM#4And because there are so many ways to do the same thing on the MA, here is one more...The long press you are looking for is actually the attributes filter menu.If you insert this line in your macro:Menu "AF" OnIt will bring up that filter screen.I hope that helps.- Kurt
